title: Nature Connection
description: Rediscovering your place in the natural world

modules.title: The Severed Connection
modules.description: Understanding how we became disconnected from nature

modules.title: Why Nature Matters
modules.description: The physical, mental, and spiritual benefits of nature

modules.title: Attention in Nature
modules.description: Learning to truly see and perceive the natural world

modules.title: Practices of Connection
modules.description: Ways to deepen your relationship with nature

modules.title: Nature as Teacher
modules.description: What the natural world can teach us about life

modules.title: Living in Relationship
modules.description: Integrating nature connection into daily life

questions.question: According to the course, nature disconnection is primarily caused by:
options: Evolution making nature unnecessary
Modern life patterns separating us from the natural world
Nature becoming more dangerous
Humans outgrowing their need for nature

questions.question: Research shows that time in nature:
options: Has no measurable health effects
Only benefits physical health, not mental
Reduces stress, improves mood, and enhances cognition
Is only beneficial for children

questions.question: The main barrier to attention in nature is:
options: Lack of interesting things to see
Not having enough knowledge about nature
Mental noise and habitual inattention
Poor eyesight

questions.question: Forest bathing (shinrin-yoku) emphasizes:
options: Vigorous exercise in forests
Slow, sensory immersion in forest atmosphere
Swimming in forest streams
Collecting forest plants

questions.question: According to the course, humans are:
options: Separate from nature and observers of it
Part of nature, not separate from it
Superior to nature and meant to control it
No longer connected to natural systems
